document_data.name: Thuunlakalaga
document_data.mainbody: The '''Thuunlakalaga''' was a clan of [[goliath]]s that dwelled within the [[Spine of the World]] mountains as of the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Activities:
Clan younglings underwent a coming-of-age ceremony that involved offering up a symbol of their childhood and venturing through a [[rune]]-covered tunnel that induced extrasensory visions.

Like other nearby clans, the Thuunlakalaga goliaths were fond of the game [[goat-ball]].
document_data.Base of Operations: The Thuunlakalaga clan made their home within [[Wyrmdoom Crag]] in the Spine of the World mountains.
document_data.Relationships: The clan had a long and ongoing feud with the [[Akannathi]] goliaths of [[Skytower Shelter]], that originated from a catastrophic game of goat-ball that led to a wounded Thuunlakalaga child and a slain Akannathi [[griffon]].
document_data.History: A short time after settling within their mountainside home, the Thuunlakalaga goliaths were attacked by a full-grown [[white dragon]]. The clanmates fought alongside one another to slay the monstrous dragon, and decorated the entrance to their home with its remains.
document_data.Notable Members:
* [[Aruk Thuunlakalaga|Aruk Thundercaller]], a warrior that nursed the [[aarakocra]] [[Sikki-kree]] back to health after she fell to the ground during a blizzard.
* [[Demelok Thuunlakalaga|Demelok Nightwalker]], an elderly clansman that helped goliath youths prepare for their trial of adulthood.
* [[Suuk Thuunlakalaga|Suuk One-Feather]], a skilled but solitary hunter that traveled far and wide across the Spine of the World.{{Cite adventurers league/The Frozen North|18}}
* [[Wayani Thuunlakalaga|Wayani Highhunter]], the clan's weaponsmith.
